intro: Jatropha gossypiifolia f. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf common jatropha, is a variant of the common jatropha species. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant features broad, heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain toxic seeds. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in disturbed soils. Its botanical structure makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening due to its vibrant floral display.
